title: How to Beat "One" on Expert in Guitar Hero

steps.headline: First off, practice, practice, practice!
steps.description: This is considered the 4th hardest song in the game and you won't beat it the first time trying!

steps.headline: Be sure you are ready for this.
steps.description: You should be able to hit as good as everything before the fast strum. If not, there is a good chance you aren't good enough to beat it yet.

steps.headline: Train on playing fast hammer-ons and pull-offs (you don't have to be amazing).
steps.description: this will help later on in the song during the solo.

steps.headline: Collect and save up Star Power phrases from the parts before the solo and fast strumming for the hardest triplet part.
steps.description: The more the better, and a full bar might help a lot.

steps.headline: Go into practice and try to get the fast strum riff before the solo down.
steps.description: You don't want your performance meter to be down on the red when the triplets of death solo hits you. Listen for the amount of drum hits on the slowest speed (there are about six to ten per line of green notes) if you struggle to find the tempo: the guitar and snare drum follows the same tempo.

steps.headline: When the triplet solo comes, keep your first finger on the note closest to the green note every set of different triplets (beginning of solo A) you come across.
steps.description: Keep it anchored there while trying to hit the rest of the note with your other fingers.

steps.headline: Try strumming the first note in every triplet if you can't tap them (or just try to alt strum).
steps.description: If the triplet goes Green-Red-Yellow, strum the Green note and then slide your fingers upwards the neck to try to hit the other notes. This requires practice and possibly sweaty fingers to make them glide easier. You might find not holding in the lowest button easier in some cases.

steps.headline: Be ready for the "snake" pattern in Solo B!
steps.description: Be sure you can handle it. Finger-gliding works pretty well on it, as long as you do not anchor (permanently press down a button) any notes and uses all fingers in the process.

steps.headline: Survive the rest of the strums to achieve victory.
Congratulations, you are now ready to beat "One"!

text: First off, practice, practice, practice! This is considered the 4th hardest song in the game and you won't beat it the first time trying! Be sure you are ready for this. You should be able to hit as good as everything before the fast strum. If not, there is a good chance you aren't good enough to beat it yet. Train on playing fast hammer-ons and pull-offs (you don't have to be amazing). this will help later on in the song during the solo. Collect and save up Star Power phrases from the parts before the solo and fast strumming for the hardest triplet part. The more the better, and a full bar might help a lot. Go into practice and try to get the fast strum riff before the solo down. You don't want your performance meter to be down on the red when the triplets of death solo hits you. Listen for the amount of drum hits on the slowest speed (there are about six to ten per line of green notes) if you struggle to find the tempo: the guitar and snare drum follows the same tempo. When the triplet solo comes, keep your first finger on the note closest to the green note every set of different triplets (beginning of solo A) you come across. Keep it anchored there while trying to hit the rest of the note with your other fingers. Try strumming the first note in every triplet if you can't tap them (or just try to alt strum). If the triplet goes Green-Red-Yellow, strum the Green note and then slide your fingers upwards the neck to try to hit the other notes. This requires practice and possibly sweaty fingers to make them glide easier. You might find not holding in the lowest button easier in some cases. Be ready for the "snake" pattern in Solo B! Be sure you can handle it. Finger-gliding works pretty well on it, as long as you do not anchor (permanently press down a button) any notes and uses all fingers in the process. Survive the rest of the strums to achieve victory.  Congratulations, you are now ready to beat "One"!
